summary: This mod makes casting casting spells and opening locks require a perk. Designed to be used alongside PerMa.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#ff0000][u][b][size=4]Introduction[/size] [/b][/u][/color]

[color=#00ff00]NOTE: There's a version of Spell Perk Restrictions for Vanilla, SkyRe, Requiem and Ordinator available [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58987/?]here[/url]. Be sure to check it out if you're using any of these overhaul.[/color]

This is a small tweak to be used alongside PerMa in order to make learning magic and opening locks more difficult, yet also more realistic.

My mod is 100% script free, so there should be no harm for your save game.

It was inspired by the mod [b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/43057/?]"Tomes - Immersive Spell Learning"[/url][/b] by pointed86 and [b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29979/?]"Lock Overhaul"[/url][/b] by Quad2Core.Â  Which are both great mods which I really liked, but sadly they're incompatible with PerMa.

While my small tweak is not nearly as fancy, I made an attempt to recreate the overall effect: making spells and locks require a perk.

I have found it very immersion breaking when I came across a spelltome, just have to click it and be able to cast the spell, regardless of any of the magic skills of my character.

In many cases, it was possible to use a high level spell, on a character with only level 15 in that school of magic.

Also, opening locks is supposed to be an art. A novice should not be able to open Master level locks, in my opinion. It takes time and effort to understand the mechanics of locks.

[color=#ff0000][u][size=4]Spells Restrictions[/size][/u][/color]

This part of the mod multiplies the Magicka cost of spells you don't have the perk (the Studies perks in PerMa) for, by 5. So in most cases, you won't be able to cast them at all without the correct perk. Lorewise, without the perk, you don't have the proper grasp of that magic school to fully comprehend the spell and therefor cannot cast it properly. Like Farengar hints: you need aptitude to be a great wizard.

I have given the Player NPC (00000007) a set of perks which multiplies the Magicka cost of all tier grade spells by 5.

By "tier grade spells" I mean the ones that belong to any of these perks:

Restoration Novice
Restoration Apprentice
Restoration Adept
Restoration Expert
Restoration Master

Destruction Novice
Destruction Apprentice
Destruction Adept
Destruction Expert
Destruction Master

Alteration Novice
Alteration Apprentice
Alteration Adept
Alteration Expert
Alteration Master

Illusion Novice
Illusion Apprentice
Illusion Adept
Illusion Expert
Illusion Master

Conjuration Novice
Conjuration Apprentice
Conjuration Adept
Conjuration Expert
Conjuration Master

Ingame, in the spell menu, you can see which of these perks each specific spell belongs to.

When you invest in the corresponding perks, the Magicka cost will return to its base value. Which makes the spells useable again.

This mod does not only apply to Vanilla and official DLC spells, but also to most spells added from other mods that belong to any of the
perks mentioned above. Meaning it's compatible with most spell mods. i.e.: the restrictions will also apply to most spells added other mods.

[color=#ff0000][size=4][u]Lockpicking Restrictions[/u][/size][/color]

For lockpicking, I reduced the chance of opening a lock, you don't have the correct perk for, to zero.

I have added following perks to the Dexterity tree:

(Novice can be opened without a perk)

- Studies: Apprentice Locks: level 25 in Dexterity

- Studies: Adept Locks: level 40 in Dexterity

- Studies: Expert Locks: level 65 in Dexterity

- Studies: Master Locks: level 90 in Dexterity

[color=#ff0000][u][size=4][b]Installing[/b][/size][/u][/color]

NMM/MO: Just install with your mod manager of choice.

Manually: Copy "Spells & Lockpicking Restriction - PerMa.esp" into your Skyrim\Data folder.

[color=#ff0000][u][size=4][b]Uninstalling[/b][/size][/u][/color]

Uninstalling mods is not recommended by Bethesda, and I do not recommend it either.

However, as my mod uses no scripts, you should IN THEORY be safe to just uninstall, by deleting it from your load order.

If you're planning on removing the Lockpicking part, you might have to reset your perks in Dexterity. If you're not sure how to do that, I'll link you to this video (a bit old, but still works): [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PqfBFq_MknE]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PqfBFq_MknE[/url]
[color=#ff0000][u]
[size=4][b]Known (in)compatibilities[/b][/size][/u][/color]

As I said, my mod should be compatible with most other spell mods, but if not, please feel free to report.

My mod is incompatible with mods that also alter the Player NPC (0000007). However, if you know how to use Merged Patches, you might be able to make them compatible.

This mod is designed to be used alongside PerMa. You NEED the PerMa Master file, otherwise you'll CTD on startup.

Also, don't forget to rerun PatchusMaximus after installing this mod.

[color=#00ff00]Compatible[/color]:

- [color=#00ff00]Skyrim Unbound[/color]: Now fully compatible, just load my mod after Skyrim Unbound.

- [color=#00ff00]Duel Combat - Realism[/color]: Fully compatible, load my mod after Duel Combat Realism.

- [color=#00ff00]Destroy the Thieves Guild[/color]: Fully compatible, load my mod after this.

[color=#ff0000][u][size=4][b]Credits[/b][/size][/u][/color]

The whole modding community - For making the game even more awesome! <3

I hope you like my mod.

Kind regards :)

Andre

files.changelogHtml:
- Gave the PerMa Waterwalking spell the correct level, so it now requires the Alteration Adept perk correctly.

- Added a fix for Equilibrium. If you don't have the Alteration Adept perk, it won't restore Magicka and only damage your health when casting.

- Gave Arniels Convection and Summon Unbound Dremora the appropriate perk requirement

- Packaged everything in an all in one FOMOD installer
